alert.note: Alert for Faribault; Martin (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 7:42PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Faribault and east central Martin Counties through 815 PM CDT... At 742 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles west of Blue Earth, or 12 miles east of Fairmont, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Blue Earth around 750 PM CDT. Elmore around 755 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Frost and Bricelyn. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 100 and 130. U.S. Highway 169 between mile markers 1 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
